intro: Gustavia integrifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf mahoe, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and large, palmate leaves that are typically 10–20 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are white or pale yellow, followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated in tropical gardens and landscapes.
